snippet: Renewed shelling and bombing around the border town of Arsal raised new alarms about the spread of Syria’s civil war.
abstract: Cease-fire between Syrian Islamist insurgents and Lebanese Army forces collapses almost immediately, raising new alarms about infectious spread of Syria's civil war into Lebanon; planned 24-hour break in fighting had been meant to provide window for medical workers and relief officials to extricate the wounded and provide aid for refugees around besieged town of Arsal.

byline.original: By HWAIDA SAAD and RICK GLADSTONE
byline.contributor: Hwaida Saad reported from Beirut, and Rick Gladstone from New York.

lead_paragraph: Renewed shelling and bombing around the border town of Arsal raised new alarms about the spread of Syria’s civil war.

headline.main: Cease-Fire Between Syrian Insurgents and Lebanese Army Ends Quickly
headline.print_headline: Cease-Fire Between Syrian Insurgents and Lebanese Army Ends Quickly

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
